Package runner

Class BenchmarkRunner

java.lang.Object
runner.BenchmarkRunner
public class BenchmarkRunner
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains a runner used to measure the runtime of the core frechet distance and Isomap implementations.

Based on the machine this code is performed on it might take multiple hours to finish the calculations. For comparable results the test should be run multiple times and averaged. The machine should not be used in the meantime.

The Polygons used for the speed benchmarks are generated from a WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

    • MEASURE_POLYGONS_AMOUNT

      private static final int MEASURE_POLYGONS_AMOUNT
      Length of the Polygon lists used for measure benchmarks. The number of resulting measurements is the square of this constant.

  • Constructor Details

    • BenchmarkRunner

      public BenchmarkRunner​(int embeddingPolygonLength, int[] embeddingPolygonAmounts, int[] embeddingDimensions, int[] landmarkAmounts, int[] neighborhoodSizes, int[] polygonLengths)
      Constructs a new BenchmarkRunner object using the given parameters for speed tests. Runtimes of all feasible combinations of these parameters will be measured.

      All needed Polygon datasets are initialized upon creation. Therefore instantiation might take some time.

      Parameters:
      embeddingPolygonLength - the length of the Polygons used in the Isomap speed benchmark
      embeddingPolygonAmounts - the lengths of the Polygon arrays used in the Isomap speed benchmark
      embeddingDimensions - the numbers of dimensions the data set is embedded in during the Isomap speed benchmark
      landmarkAmounts - the numbers of landmarks used during the Isomap speed benchmark
      neighborhoodSizes - the numbers of nearest neighbors used to construct a graph from during the Isomap speed benchmark
      polygonLengths - the lengths of the Polygons used for the measure speed benchmark

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method making this class a runner for the benchmark it implements.

      A BenchmarkRunner-Instance is initialized and used to perform the runtime test.

      Parameters:
      args - unused

    • warmup

      public void warmup()
      Uses a variety of methods, whose runtime should be tested later.

      The Java Hotspot-VM optimizes the code during runtime. Therefore it is important to let it do most of these optimizations before starting the speed benchmark.

      To warm up the full variety of methods, a dataset is simply embedded using Isomap and the different Measures.

    • addPolygonListsFromFeatures

      private void addPolygonListsFromFeatures​(java.util.List<java.util.List<Polygon>> polygonLists, java.util.Map<WeatherFeature,​java.lang.Double> features)
      Appends the required polygon datasets to the given List.

      Since Polygons generated from a WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory are used for the speed benchmarks, a Map of WeatherFeatures must be given defining those Polygons.

      All these lists have a predefiend length of MEASURE_POLYGONS_AMOUNT

      Parameters:
      polygonLists - the List to add the generated Polygon lists to
      features - the features and weights used to generate Polygons. The size of this parameter determines the dimension of the Polygons.

    • isomapBenchmark

      private void isomapBenchmark()
      Measures and prints runtimes of all the required components for calculating an embedding using Isomap. All feasible combinations of the benchmarks parameters.

      Using these abbreviations

      • n = embeddingPolygonAmounts
      • k = neighborhoodSizes
      • δ = measures
      • l = landmarkAmounts
      • d = embeddingDimensions
      the tested combinations are
      • n×k×δ for neighborhood graphs
      • n×k×δ for connecting graph components
      • n×k×l for calculating shortest paths
      • n×l×d for embedding using LMDS

    • measureBenchmark

      private void measureBenchmark()
      Measures and prints runtimes of average measure durations. All combinations of some polygon dimensions, polygon lengths and measures are tested.

      The printed time values are given in μs per measurement, averaged over many measurements.

    • setupPolygons

      private void setupPolygons()
      Generates all the Polygons required for performing the benchmarks and stores them.

    • setupPolygonsForIsomap

      private Polygon[][] setupPolygonsForIsomap()
      Generates the Polygons required in the Isomap speed benchmark.

      The generated Polygons are 3-dimensional and have the defined length. They are taken from the grid weather data set using a WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory.

      Returns:
      the Polygon arrays used in the Isomap speed benchmark

    • setupPolygonsForMeasures

      private java.util.List<java.util.List<Polygon>> setupPolygonsForMeasures()
      Generates the Polygons required in the Measure speed benchmark.

      The generated Polygons have all combinations of the dimensions (2,3,5) and the defined lengths. They are taken from the grid weather data set using a WeatherGridDataPolygonsFactory.

      Returns:
      the Polygon lists used in the Measure speed benchmark
